BiblioData.Title: Nanocrystals
BiblioData.Abstract: Provided herein are compositions of functionalized, fluorescent nanocrystals comprising fluorescent nanocrystals coated with an imidazole-containing compound; compositions of funcionalized, fluorescent nanocrystals comprising fluorescent nanocrystals coated with an imidazole-containing compound and cross-linked with a phosphine cross-linking compound; compositions of functionalized fluorescent nanocrystals operably bound to molecular probe; a process of making funcionalized, fluorescent nanocrystals; and a process of using funcionalized, fluorescent nanocrystals in a detection system.

Claims.P: - a coating over said fluorescent nanocrystal, wherein said coating comprises complexes comprised of imidazole-containing compound operably bound to a metal cation, where the imidazole ring nitrogens serve as co-ordinating ligand to operably bind the metal ion;optionally wherein said fluorescent nanocrystal is selected from core semiconductor materials, core/shell semiconductor nanocrystals, doped metal oxide nanocrystals, and combinations thereof.
2. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of claim 1, wherein said metal cation comprises semiconductor material.
3. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of claim 1, wherein the metal cation comprises one or more of Zn<2+>, Cu<2+>, Fe<2+>, Ni<2+>, Cd<2+> and Co<2+>.
4. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, wherein the coating comprises imidazole-containing compound operably bound to Cd<2+> or Zn<2+> by imidazole complexation.
5. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, wherein said metal cation is Zn<2+> operably bound to a sulfur containing compound.
6. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, further comprising a molecular probe, one or more molecules of which are operably bound to the coated fluorescent material.

7. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, further comprising cross-linking of the coating, optionally wherein the reactive functionalities used to cross-link are selected from amino groups, carboxyl groups, and a combination thereof.

8. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, wherein the coating further comprises a phosphine cross-linking compound, optionally wherein the phosphine cross-linking compound comprises a hydroxymethyl-phosphine compound.
9. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim, wherein the imidazole-containing compound comprises an amino acid or an oligopeptide.
10. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of claim 9, wherein the imidazole-containing compound comprises a dipeptide.

11. The functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any of claims 1 to 10, wherein the imidazole-containing compound comprises histidine, carnosine, anserine, baleine, homocarnasine, 1-methylhistidine, 3-methylhistidine, imidazolysine, 5-methylimidazalone, [beta]-2-imidazolyl-L-a-alanine, carcine or histamine, and optionally wherein the imidazole-containing compound comprises histidine or carnosine.

12. The nanocrystal of any preceding claim, wherein the nanocrystal is comprised of a core comprised of at least one Group II-VI semiconductor material, and optionally coated with a Group II-VI semiconductor shell.
13. The nanocrystal of claim 12, wherein the nanocrystal is comprised of ZnS, or CdSe.

14. The nanocrystal of any of claim 12 or claim 13, wherein the semiconductor core is coated with a shell comprised of YZ wherein Y is Cd or Zn, and Z is S or Se, and the imidazole-containing compound.
15. A detection system, comprising a functionalized fluorescent nanocrystal of any preceding claim and an excitation source suitable to elicit fluorescence from the coated fluorescent nanocrystal.
